				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;13.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:308.80pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Income Taxes:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The provision (benefit) for income taxes for years ended December 31
 2013
 2012 and 2011 are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:43.04%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.16%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:15.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.16%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 which occurred February 1
 2013 with the shares being distributed February 25
 2013
 the Company and its subsidiaries were included in the consolidated federal and certain consolidated or combined state income tax returns of Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;However
 the provisions for income taxes in the consolidated statements of operations &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;were&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; determined on a theoretical separate-return basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Due to the Company&amp;#x2019;s history of pre-tax losses
 as of the Distribution date the Company did not reflect a benefit for its net operating loss carryforwards (&amp;#x201C;NOLs&amp;#x201D;) since the Company was unable to conclude it was more likely than not that it would have been able to generate future taxable income to use the NOLs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As noted in Note 3
 as of December 31
 2013 the Company determined that it was more likely than not that some of the tax benefit related to the deferred tax assets would be realized and reduced the valuation allowance.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company filed a California state income tax return separate from Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The statute of limitations with respect to the Company&amp;#x2019;s California state tax return has expired for all years through 2008.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company currently has no unrecognized tax benefits
 and it is not reasonably possible to estimate the amount by which that could increase in the next twelve months since the timing of examinations
 if any
 is unknown.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 no formal tax sharing agreement was entered into between the Company and Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On the Distribution date
 the Company and Leucadia entered into a tax matters agreement that governs the parties&amp;#x2019; respective rights
 responsibilities and obligations with respect to tax liabilities and benefits
 tax attributes
 the preparation and filing of tax returns
 the control of audits and other tax proceedings and other matters regarding taxes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In general
 with respect to any periods ending at or prior to the Distribution
 Leucadia will be responsible for any federal income tax liabilities and any state or local income taxes reportable on a consolidated
 combined or unitary return
 in each case
 as would be applicable to the Company as if it filed tax returns on a stand-alone basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;With respect to any periods beginning after the Distribution
 the Company will be responsible for any federal
 state or local income taxes of it or any of its subsidiaries.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company will not be required to reimburse Leucadia for any payments made by Leucadia for adjustments to taxable periods prior to the Distribution
 nor will the Company be entitled to any refunds for adjustments to taxable periods prior to the Distribution.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company is responsible for any adjustments or liabilities related to its California state income tax return for all periods.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The principal components of deferred taxes at December 31
 2013 and 2012 are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

371

252
000)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$684
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for 2013
 2012 and 2011 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Subsequent to the Distribution
 the Company retained all of its California State NOLs; however
 the Company retained federal NOLs only to the extent that they had not been previously used in Leucadia&amp;#x2019;s consolidated return.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$21
992
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of the decrease in the valuation allowance for 2013 is due to the elimination of such NOLs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Additionally
 as of December 31
 2013
 the Company determined it is more likely than not that a portion of the NOLs will be utilized to offset future taxable income
 and therefore
 reduced the allowance to reflect a net deferred tax asset of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2
500
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31

				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:11.12%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;31

			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Under certain circumstances
 the ability to use the NOLs and future deductions could be substantially reduced if certain changes in ownership were to occur.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In order to reduce this possibility
 the Company&amp;#x2019;s certificate of incorporation includes a charter restriction that prohibits transfers of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock under certain circumstances.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:8pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The table below reconciles the expected statutory income tax rate to the actual income tax provision (benefit):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Income taxes:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Income taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method
 which requires the recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the consolidated financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Under this method
 deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the differences between the financial statements and the tax basis of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The effect of a change in tax rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities is recognized in income in the period that includes the enacted date.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Net tax assets are recorded to the extent the Company believes these assets will more likely than not be realized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In making such determination
 the Company considers all available positive and negative evidence
 including scheduled reversals of deferred tax liabilities
 projected future taxable income
 tax planning strategies and recent financial results of operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Prior to 2013
 the Company had recorded a full valuation allowance related to its net deferred tax asset.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2013
 the Company determined it is more likely than not that a portion of the deferred tax asset will be realized in the future
 and therefore reduced the valuation allowance resulting in the recognition o&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;f a net deferred tax asset of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2
500
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:8pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Prior to the Distribution
 the Company and its subsidiaries were included in the consolidated federal and certain consolidated or combined state income tax returns of Leucadia.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;However
 the provisions for income taxes in the consolidated statements of operations have been determined on a theoretical separate-return basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company does not have any unrecognized tax benefits; however
 if it did the Company would record accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits as income tax expense.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;See Note 13 for more information.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

 2013

514
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for each of the next five years.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.20%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:right;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:19.20%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;43
061&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Inventory -&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market
 with cost being determined on the first-in
 first-out method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs associated with winemaking
 and other costs associated with the manufacturing of products for resale
 are recorded as inventory.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In accordance with general practice within the wine industry
 wine inventories are included in current assets
 although a portion of such inventories may be aged for periods longer than one year.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As required
 the Company reduces the carrying value of inventories that are obsolete or in excess of estimated usage to estimated net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company&amp;#x2019;s estimates of net realizable value are based on analyses and assumptions including
 but not limited to
 historical usage
 future demand and market requirements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Reductions to the carrying value of inventories are recorded in cost of sales.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;If future demand and/or pricing for the Company&amp;#x2019;s products are less than previously estimated
 then the carrying value of the inventories may be required to be reduced
 resulting in additional expense and reduced profitability.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Inventory write-downs of $0
 $50
000 and $51
000 were recorded during 2013
 2012 and 2011
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 0pt 18pt;text-indent: -18pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=font-weight:bold;display: inline;font-weight:normal;&gt;7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-weight:bold;display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-weight:bold;display: inline;;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 12pt 0pt 0pt;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Financial Instruments:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 18pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s material financial instruments include cash and cash equivalents and investments classified as available for sale; investments classified as available for sale are the only assets or liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investments mature within &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years or less.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The par value
 amortized cost
 gross unrealized gains and losses and estimated fair value of investments classified as available for sale as of December 31
 2013 and December 31
 2012 are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

 2013 and 2012
 the Company did not have any &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; or &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis.&lt;/font&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For cash and cash equivalents
 the carrying amounts of such financial instruments approximate their fair values.&lt;/font&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company does not invest in any derivatives or engage in any hedging activities.&lt;/font&gt;

				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;16.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:304.05pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Litigation:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company and its subsidiaries may become parties to legal proceedings that are considered to be either ordinary
 routine litigation incidental to their business or not significant to the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial position or liquidity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company does not believe that there is any pending litigation that could have a significant adverse impact on its consolidated financial position
 liquidity or results of operations.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:15.75pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:47.25pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.40pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;776&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:05.35pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 3.3pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Concentrations of risk:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company sells the majority of its wine through distributors and retailers.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Receivables arising from these sales are not collateralized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For the years ended December 31
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 sales to one customer accounted for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;14%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;14%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of total sales
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Amounts due from this customer represented approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;26%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of accounts receivable as of December 31
 2013 and 2012
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company maintains its cash in bank deposit accounts that
 at times
 may exceed FDIC insurance &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;thresholds.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:332.75pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:332.75pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Nature of Operations:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company operates in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; segment
 the production and sale of premium
 ultra premium and luxury wines (i.e.
 wines that retail for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$14&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$14&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and over &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; per 750ml bottle
 respectively).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Crimson is headquartered in Napa
 California and through its wholly-owned subsidiaries owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;four&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; wineries: Pine Ridge Vineyards
 Archery Summit
 Chamisal Vineyards and Seghesio Family Vineyards.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Pine Ridge was acquired in 1991 and has been conducting operations since 1978
 Crimson started Archery Summit in 1993
 Chamisal Vineyards was acquired in 2008 and has been conducting operations since 1973
 and Seghesio Family Vineyards was acquired in 2011 and has been conducting operations since 1895.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Additionally
 in 2005 and 2006 Double Canyon Vineyards
 a wholly owned subsidiary
 was acquired
 consisting of an aggregate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;611&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres of land in the Horse Heaven Hills of Washington&amp;#x2019;s Columbia Valley
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;447&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; are plantable to vineyards.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company began selling wine from Washington under the Double Canyon Vineyards brand name during the Fall of 2012.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 8pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:8pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Pine Ridge Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;156&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres
 which reflects the sale of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; plantable acres of a non-strategic vineyard in January 2013
 and controls through leasing arrangements an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres of estate vineyards in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Napa Valley appellations &amp;#x2013; Stags Leap District
 Rutherford
 Oakville
 Carneros and Howell Mountain.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;165&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Archery Summit owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;100&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres and controls through leasing arrangements an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres of estate vineyards in the Willamette Valley
 Oregon.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;113&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Chamisal Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;97&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres of vineyards in the Edna Valley
 California
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;82&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Seghesio Family Vineyards owns &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;299&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres of vineyards in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Sonoma County appellations
 the Alexander Valley and Russian River Valley
 of which approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;281&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; are currently planted and producing grapes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Double Canyon Vineyards owns 447 plantable acres of vineyards in the Horse Heaven Hills of Washington
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;87&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; acres are currently planted and producing grapes.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Recent accounting pronouncements:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Effective January 1
 2012
 the Company adopted new Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#x201C;FASB&amp;#x201D;) guidance with respect to the improvement of the comparability of fair value measurements presented and disclosed in financial statements issued in accordance with GAAP and International Financial Reporting Standards.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The amendment includes requirements for measuring fair value and for disclosing information about fair value measurements
 but does not require additional fair value measurements and is not intended to establish valuation standards or affect valuation practices outside of financial reporting.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The guidance did not have any impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Effective January 1
 2013
 the Company adopted amended Financial Accounting Standards Board guidance for indefinite lived intangible asset impairment testing. The amended guidance allows an entity to assess qualitative factors to determine whether the existence of events and circumstances indicate that it is more likely than not that an indefinite lived intangible asset is impaired. If an entity concludes it is not more likely than not that an indefinite lived intangible asset is impaired
 the entity is not required to take further action. If an entity concludes otherwise
 then the entity would be required to determine the fair value of the indefinite lived intangible asset and compare the fair value with the carrying amount of the indefinite lived intangible asset. The Company was required to adopt this amended guidance for its annual and interim periods beginning January 1
 2013. The adoption of this amended guidance did not have a significant impact on the Company's consolidated financial statements&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:325.70pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:325.70pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Explanatory Note:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Crimson Wine Group
 Ltd. (&amp;#x201C;Crimson&amp;#x201D;) is a Delaware corporation that has been operating since 1991.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As used herein
 the term
 &amp;#x201C;Company&amp;#x201D; refers to Crimson and its wholly-owned subsidiaries
 except as the context may otherwise require.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Prior to February 25
 2013
 Crimson was a wholly-owned subsidiary of Leucadia National Corporation (&amp;#x201C;Leucadia&amp;#x201D;).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On February 1
 2013
 Leucadia declared a pro rata dividend of all of the outstanding shares of Crimson&amp;#x2019;s common stock in a manner that was structured to qualify as a tax-free spin-off for U.S. federal income tax purposes (the &amp;#x201C;Distribution&amp;#x201D;).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Leucadia&amp;#x2019;s common shareholders received one share of Crimson common stock for every &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; common shares of Leucadia (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;24
458
368&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Crimson common shares in the aggregate)
 with cash in lieu of fractional shares
 on February 25
 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The consolidated financial statements and notes thereto give retroactive effect to the Distribution for all periods presented.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Crimson qualifies as an &amp;#x201C;emerging growth company&amp;#x201D; as defined in the JOBS Act.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;An emerging growth company is defined as a company with total annual gross revenues of less than $1 billion in its most recently completed fiscal year.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;An emerging growth company will retain such status until the earliest of: (1) the last day of the fiscal year of the emerging growth company following the fifth anniversary of the date it first sold securities pursuant to an effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933; (2) the last day of the fiscal year in which the emerging growth company first had total annual gross revenues of $1 billion or more (indexed pursuant to the JOBS Act); (3) the date on which the emerging growth company is deemed to be a &amp;#x201C;large accelerated filer&amp;#x201D; as defined in Exchange Act Rule 12b-2 (i.e.
 an SEC registered company with a public float of at least $700 million that satisfies other tests); or (4) the date on which the emerging growth company has
 within the previous three years
 issued more than $1 billion of nonconvertible debt.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Crimson has elected to opt out of the extended transition period for complying with new or revised accounting standards pursuant to Section 107(b) of the JOBS Act.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This election is irrevocable.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:333.30pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.50pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:333.30pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;A 401(k) profit sharing plan is provided to all employees who meet certain service requirements. The Company matched &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; of a participant&amp;#x2019;s salary deferral through March 2009
 at which time
 the company match was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;suspended&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. The Company reinstated the match as of April 2011.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Total company contributions to the plan were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$150
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$132
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$67
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the years ended December 31
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For the years ended December 31
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 depreciation expense was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$5
343
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$5
444
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4
977
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4
495
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4
639
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4
317
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 capitalized into inventory and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$848
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$805
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$660
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively
 charged to the statements of operations.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In January 2013
 the Company sold a non-strategic vineyard for net cash consideration.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recorded a pre-tax gain of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$717
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 net of closing costs
 during the first quarter of 2013.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company is committed to spend approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$239
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; in the aggregate for vineyards under development and construction in progress.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Property and equipment:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Property and equipment are stated at cost and are depreciated using the straight-line method over the related assets estimated useful lives.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs of maintenance and repairs are charged to expense as incurred; significant renewals and betterments are capitalized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Costs incurred developing vineyards are capitalized until the vineyard becomes commercially productive.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For 2013 and 2012
 the total of quarterly per share amounts does not equal the annual per share amount due to rounding&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Accounts receivable:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accounts receivable are reported at net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest is not accrued on past-due amounts.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accounts are charged against the allowance to bad debt as they are deemed uncollectible based upon a periodic review of the accounts.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:358.15pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:18.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;9.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:358.15pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.40pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Due to Leucadia and its Affiliates:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Amounts that were due to Leucadia and its affiliates did bear interest at a specified bank prime rate plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0.125%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All amounts were payable on demand
 except for the $45
000
000 note issued to Leucadia in connection with the acquisition of Seghesio Family Vineyards that was originally due May 13
 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Unpaid interest
 if any
 was added to the principal balance on a quarterly basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest expense to Leucadia and its affiliates was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$783
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$5
192
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4
494
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; for the years ended December 31
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Arial;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;On February 25
 2013
 the remaining balance of due to affiliates was contributed by Leucadia to capital.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Revenue recognition:&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recognizes revenue from product sales upon shipment or delivery provided that persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 which for sales to wholesalers is a purchase order
 the price is fixed
 title has transferred
 collection of resulting receivables is reasonably assured
 there are no customer acceptance requirements
 and there are no remaining significant obligations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The cost of depletion allowances and price promotions are treated as reductions of revenues and can be reasonably estimated based upon experience.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Revenue from products sold through retail locations
 wine clubs and the Internet is recognized when the product is received by the customer and payment is received
 based on published retail prices and applicable published discounts.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Revenue includes any shipping and handling costs billed to the customer
 and such amounts are not expected to be sufficient to cover actual costs.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:15.38%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&lt;div style=float:left&gt;&lt;/div&gt;3&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:43.04%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;line-height:100%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Federal income taxes:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For 2013 and 2012
 the total of quarterly per share amounts does not equal the annual per share amount due to rounding&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
